Detailed Description

Single efficient Value class.

This class replaces the behaviour and functionality of the Value YARP class. It is the base class that allows simple data transmission. To transmit more complex data, list eValues can be used.

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum yarp::os::eValue::ValueType

Basic types allowed in data transmission.

These are the simple value types that can be transmitted

Enumerator:
INT  Integer data.
DOUBLE  Double precission floating point data.
CHARP  Blob of bytes.
BOTTLE  List of eValues.
STRING  String of characters.

eValue::eValue ( const char *  p,
const unsigned int  size_p 
)

Blob eValue constructor.

Creates an eValue with a blob of bytes. It Reserves its own memory and makes a copy of the blob.

Parameters:
[in] p A pointer to the memory to store
[in] size_p The size of the memory blob in bytes

References CHARP.

eValue::eValue ( const eBottle *  p  ) 

List eValue constructor.

Creates an eValue with a list. The eValue do not copy the eBottle before storing it.

Parameters:
[in] p The pointer to the list to store

References BOTTLE.

Member Function Documentation

eValue * eValue::makeBlob ( const char *  p,
const unsigned int  size 
) [static]

blob type eValue factory

Creates a dynamically allocated eValue with a blob inside. The blob is copied before stored.

Parameters:
[in] p A pointer to the memory to store
[in] size The size of the memory blob in bytes
Returns:
A pointer to the new eValue

References eValue().
